title: State/Territory Sponsored Regional Established Business in Australia visa (subclass 846)
summary: This page provides details for applicants who previously applied for the State/Territory Sponsored Regional Established Business in Australia visa (subclass 846), which closed to new applications on 1 July 2012. It explains requirements, how to add family members, health and character checks, application processing steps, and the document checklist required for the visa decision process.

visa_information.visa_name: State/Territory Sponsored Regional Established Business in Australia visa
visa_information.applicant_location_requirement_on_decisi: Applicant must be in Australia when the visa is decided
visa_information.alternative_information: Information on other business visas available on the SkillSelect website

applicable_applicants.description: People who have already applied for the visa and are waiting for a decision

adding_family_members.allowed_until: Any time until visa is decided
eligible_family_members: Other dependent family members who meet requirements

forms_required.purpose: Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa

requirements: Family members must meet eligibility requirements
Must meet health and character requirements
May need to provide IELTS test results

notes: Most applicants will not need additional examinations
Do not arrange a health examination until asked

required_documents: Police certificate from each country lived in for 12 months or more in the past 10 years after turning 16

debts_to_government.requirement: No outstanding debts to the Australian Government or must have arrangements to repay before visa can be granted

lodging_application.instructions: Lodge completed forms and documents in person, or by registered post, courier or fax
lodging_application.location: Adelaide office in South Australia - Attention Client Services, Adelaide Business Skills Processing Centre

after_applying.acknowledgement: Applicant will receive confirmation of information received

bridging_visa_information.eligibility: Applicants applying in Australia may receive a Bridging visa
bridging_visa_information.bridging_visa_b_travel_permission: Can apply for Bridging Visa B to travel

providing_more_information.allowed_until: Any time until a decision is made
department_actions: May ask for more information with a deadline
May request identity documents at interview

must_report: Phone number, email, address or passport changes

withdrawing_application.instructions: Send a letter or email requesting withdrawal
required_information: File reference number, client ID, or TRN
withdrawing_application.signature_requirement: All applicants aged 18 or older must sign

if_refused: Time limit to lodge an appeal

general_instructions: Provide certified copies of original documents
Do not send originals unless asked
Documents not in English must have accredited translations

forms.purpose: Application for a Business Skills (permanent) visa
Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over
forms.applicability: Family members aged 18 or older who are not the partner

forms.purpose: Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment

identity_documents: Certified copies of biographical passport pages for all applicants
Two recent passport-sized photographs of each applicant (45mm x 35mm)
Certified evidence of name change (if applicable)
family_documents: Certified birth certificates or family book showing parents' names
Legal evidence of permission to bring a child under 18 to Australia if the other parent is not included (e.g., Form 1229 or statutory declaration)
